newsitem.title: UK: ALEA seeks AIM listing to fund lottery projects.
newsitem.headline: ALEA seeks AIM listing to fund lottery projects.

text.p: ALEA Limited said on Tuesday it planned to list on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) by means of a placing to raise 32.4 million stg.
It plans to establish and operate lotteries worldwide, with the emphasis on the emerging markets of the former Soviet Union, Africa and South America.
Bermuda-based ALEA was set up by Halstead Corporation Ltd, an investment vehicle of Elliot Bernerd, chairman of property group Chelsfield Plc.
The company will invest most of the 23 million stg proceeds from the float in its first project, a joint venture to establish a Russian National Lottery.

Following the placing Halstead will hold 30 percent of ALEA's issued share capital. EssNet, the lottery equipment and systems manufacturer and supplier, which will operate the Russian lottery, will have 20 percent.

"This exciting lottery project is a major opportunity to establish ALEA in a leading position in the emerging markets," said chairman Terry Robinson. Broker and adviser to the flotation is Henderson Crosthwaite.
